item.title: Mexico Packing Essentials

item.description: In just over a week, we’re heading to Riviera Maya, Mexico for our 1-year anniversary. I’m a firm believer in switching up your vacations – some [...]

item.title: Strawberry Rhubarb Pie
item.dc:creator: Emily
item.description: Without question, strawberry rhubarb is my favorite flavor of pie, but I’ve actually never attempted to make it until now. While I feel pretty confident in my baking skills, I haven’t had the best of luck with fruit based pies. They often turn out too loose and runny, but after following this Cook’s Illustrated recipe, [...]

item.title: Crave or Save

item.description: I switch up my sunglasses often (and store them here for easy access) since they have the ability to transform the entire vibe of an outfit.  I recently splurged on a pair of Illesteva sunglasses (seen here and here), which are similar to this multicolor pair. The quality of the sunglasses is undeniable, but these from Madewell  [...]

item.title: Five Things
item.dc:creator: Emily
item.description: {A Sunday afternoon of baking and decorating spring cookies with a friend} Working from home has its benefits. There’s no commute, I never have to pack a lunch (a true bonus for someone who’s a constant snacker) and my cats are always nearby. But it can also be tough to separate my work from my [...]

item.title: A Spin on Salad
item.dc:creator: Emily
item.description: I go to the Farmers’ Market every Sunday and come back with bags full of fresh produce. And even though there’s abundant inspiration in each aisle, I find myself picking up the same salad ingredients each week: lettuce, avocados, and tomatoes (even though they’re not entirely ripe just yet). My salads have become predictable and [...]

item.title: Rosé Sangria
item.dc:creator: Emily
item.description: Sangria is synonymous with warmer weather and it’s one of the easiest things to serve when we have people over. We make it ahead of time and the longer it sits, the more all of the flavors really begin to meld together. I usually opt for a citrus white wine version, but this past week, [...]

item.title: Crave or Save
item.dc:creator: Emily
item.description: A good statement necklace, with intricate beading, bright colors, and an interesting shape, has become my quintessential go-to accessory. My preference will always be vintage gems that I pick up at flea markets, but when it comes to current jewelry designers, Tom Binns’ creations are works of art. This hand-painted necklace is beautiful and would [...]

item.description: Since I wear my hair up in a ponytail several times a week, I wanted to dress it up a bit, so it doesn’t always look so casual (seen here). I’ve purchased fancy hair ties in the past – ones with tortoise shell and beading, but when the elastics break, you’re out of luck. I [...]
